title: Tenant Services Coordinator at Vornado: A Dynamic Role with Growth Potential and Diverse Exposure
pros: Pros: Exposure to a wide variety of Class A properties across New York, offering diverse experience. Opportunity to work closely with property managers, leasing teams, vendors, and tenants. Involvement in both operational and financial aspects like payroll, invoice processing, and budgeting. Collaborative team environment with chances for long-term career growth within Vornado. Experience working with high-profile commercial properties and interaction with executive management.
cons: Cons: Job requires adaptability to frequently changing schedules and locations across different properties. The role can be high-pressure, balancing tenant needs, vendor coordination, and multiple administrative tasks. May involve handling complex service requests and urgent building operations issues. Possibly limited relocation support for the New York office position. Work-life balance can be challenging given the dynamic and fast-paced environment.

title: Accounting Associate
pros: Teams are friendly and helpful
cons: Pay can be slightly below average

title: Not the greatest place to work
pros: There are limited pro's to this company.
cons: Salary, work/life balance, the office is gossipy and people like to throw their titles around when they're clearly underqualified and the reason that the development is not going where it needs to.

title: Underpaid
pros: Decent PTO, summer fridays (half-days)
cons: It depends on which building you are placed at, could be a great job or a horrible job. Also severely underpaid.

title: Great company to work for
pros: Great benefits including paid time off, summer Fridays, and bonus. Everyone is very supportive.
cons: Have to go in the office 5 days a week

title: Smart people but no direction
pros: Lots of smart capable people, pay is on par with market
cons: Lack of direction and no chance to do anything interesting

title: Favoritism
pros: Most people are friendly and cordial.
cons: They take advantage of employees.

title: Great people, good culture
pros: Work with excellent people who are smart and available to help
cons: None that I can think of currently

title: Solid
pros: Solid company, excellent good benefits
cons: Heavy into office market which isn't good market currently

title: Excellent Company
pros: Everyone is willing to help and upper management has been here a long time.
cons: The location is not ideal for everyone

title: Average
pros: Good medical benefits package and salary is OK
cons: poor work life balance and very stressful

title: Great Culture
pros: Collaborative and professional with years of experience in commercial real estate ownership, investing, and operations
cons: None that come to mind

title: Great Company
pros: Company cares about employees. Great benefits, and overall great place to work.
cons: None that I can think of.

title: Ok company
pros: Decent benefits. Good 401K and medical
cons: Expectations are over the top

title: A solid place to work!
pros: Vornado has some great people and good benefits. Executive Management emphasizes core values. They tend to promote from within and show appreciation to employees.
cons: Working from home is not really allowed.

title: Assistant Property Manager
pros: Good work life balance and can learn from industry pros
cons: Working conditions are sub par in most buildings.

title: Assistant Property Manager
pros: Great working environment. Get to work and learn from very knowledgeable people.
cons: I have no cons other than the long hours 8am to 5pm or 9am to 6pm.

title: Good place to work
pros: Very nice people and good work life balance
cons: None at this time, keep it up

title: Great Team...not culture
pros: Enjoyed working with the people directly related to the job , benefits were very good and comfortable work environment within your group.
cons: Actually it was very stressful to communicate if you needed to work outside of your department. Some people were not so willing to give you the time of day, even for a signature, they were unapproachable. You can tell people were stressed out and it made the job not worth it. Cliques and nepotism rated very high, made it impossible to feel welcome. You were perpetually an outsider, so you have to not care about that to make it essentially. Not recommended.

title: Make the most of your position
pros: Vornado is a large company with a very generous benefits package.
cons: Communication is an area that can be improved on in a major way. As well, departments work in silos, which can be very frustrating. Invariably, it often took a lot of time to get concrete information from other departments or associates. Many people just didn’t have the information or didn’t know whom to ask. This can be detrimental as some people specialize in blindly following standard operating procedures. Most in the real world can speak to the concept of acquiring critical thinking skills and being successful in that endeavor. Unfortunately, the organization is entrenched in operating in a particular fashion that requires a lot of leadership and muscle to unravel.

title: Mr. Roth left an indelible and inspirational footprint in my world!
pros: My two years working with Mr. Roth and his amazing team of Executives when I was 25 and just a few years out from Seton Hall University, and learned how the best in the business function, perform and transcend to excellence!! That was almost 30 years ago and now, from time to time, living my dream life in California, something grabs my attention and my mind goes back to one of the most important, motivating and empowering times in my life.
cons: Every second of my experience at Vornado brings a positive, wonderful and empowering feeling in my soul. Amazing leader, the corporate culture was professional, luxurious, progressive and rewarding and the experience on my resume is one of the many life achievements that are tools I have gained that will always be diamonds that have blessed my world.

title: Kind people with good intentions but antiquated or inferior data systems.
pros: Great group of people to work with. Feels like family from the first day you start until you leave. Supportive. Family-oriented. Open arms to all cultures.
cons: Systems are antiquated and inefficient, primarily built in-house without end-user logic. Causes a lot of overlap between departments, and no connection where there should be connection between departments. Massive amounts of manual redundancy. A lot of room for human error due to so many people having access to manual inputs. Very little opportunity for growth or promotion, but not that much less than the average company of this size.

title: Great place to work
pros: I work in the DC division and it's a great place to work. The people are the best in the industry -- both on the property management and engineering side -- and hard work and diligence is recognized and rewarded.
cons: Vornado is a large company that has scale. To leverage that scale requires a structured and hierarchical approach to management. This can be frustrating because decision are often made at high levels of the company and innovation is not often pursued, but rather is discussed with higher up, and if they think it's a good idea, then it is slowly implemented.

title: Great people, but organizational friction and sometimes aloof management
pros: Nearly everyone knows what they're doing, and they take their work very seriously. High degree of professionalism and a willingness to guide help each other.
cons: In the Paramus office, at least, it's a very "9-5" work culture. Divisions are very silo'd, with only managers communicating between them. Definitely an "office space-esque" mindset at times. Difficult to grow by moving between divisions, simply because there isn't enough contact between them.

title: Great company and employees
pros: This is a renowned company for a reason. Leadership is there to show you the standard for being a successful employee. There is a great team chemistry at each building management office. The company is always looking out for their employees through the company benefits, compensation, events, etc. This is a company you will want to establish a tenure with. It is also a great place to begin your career or to join mid-way in your later stages.
cons: I cannot seem to think of one. Ask around, Vornado is the industry standard.

title: Good place to work
pros: Good communication from home office. Property Managers were always helpful, friendly and supportive. They did a great job of encouraging growth within the company and the industry. The pay for the position was good.
cons: As a Property Administrator, the work can be a little mundane, and it is not usually very challenging. Sometimes, it is not always clear what the best choice of action is when there are conflicts between tenants and contractors.

title: manager
pros: stable company with the resources to manage the ups and downs of the industry, as a whole the company wants to do the right thing
cons: makes goals and targets for employees to make a better place to work, but fails to follow through to completion due to new or conflicting goals or lack of commitment to original goal and or consistency in treating all employees the same or offering the same perks across all locations. depends on where you work if you get the same as the next person.

title: Accounting in DC office
pros: Solid company, good benefits, work events, treats employees well
cons: Counter offers are a slap in the face, no promotions, no recognition, 3% annual raise isn't even a cost of living increase if you live at one of VNOs residential buildings where the annual rent increase is 20%; so much for a corporate discount.

title: Awesome Company!
pros: The people in this company are simply amazing. Everyone from top down is willing to chat with you, educate and mentor you, and provide insight to whatever questions you may have. While there can be a lot of turnover in certain departments, everyone is willing to lend a hand, direct you to someone who can, and just do whatever they can to help you find a solution.
cons: Some of the software and systems used aren't very intuitive or user-friendly. Migrating to something more efficient would increase work productivity.

title: Good Comprehensive Package, Stifling Culture
pros: Great comprehensive package including 401(k) matching, salary, benefits, etc. Good snacks in the kitchen. Willing to chip in a little for continuing education.
cons: Mediocre culture. Management shuffles in and out of work without really cultivating young talent. Big gap between upper management and analysts/associates. Not the best place to "grow" a career in real estate.

title: Negotiate as much money as you can before you start, You're going to need it
pros: The pay is great and they will pay you, Ask and you will receive.
cons: Negotiate as much money as you can, Search to make sure your compensation is competitive across the nation..... You will need as much money as you can to de stress from all the toxicity that you will endure on the job.

title: Great Company, Not so Great Office Staff
pros: This company is A1 in its culture! You won't just feel like another fish in ocean here. Awesome company!
cons: The con isn't with the company but at a particular property. The respect was non-existent. Just as the saying goes "You can't choose your family". Yes, you can switch properties but the backlash will follow you and you will still have to see your former staff at least 6 times a year.

title: Solid Employment with Opportunities for Growth
pros: If you are interested in the field of Property Management, this is an excellent company to work for. Lots of autonomy in field offices. Opportunities for growth and encouragement to become an RPM (I believe they will pay for this training). Fun corporate atmosphere. Annual bonuses.
cons: Health care benefits changed 3 times in the course of 3 years. Satellite offices are small so you should be comfortable working independently.

title: Professional
pros: We get to produce the highest quality work. We do not cut corners so our level of professionalism shows. We work with the best companies who are the masters of their fields as well.
cons: There is a steep hierarchy here. Sometimes you feel like your opinion does not matter.

pros: Large company with various real estate investment focus, including asset mgt an property management. Good benefits, although employee contribution keeps increasing.
cons: Long hours, high pressure and most accomplishments are not recognized sufficiently, including during year end review. Lots of cliques with little social work related activities.

title: Great Company but things need to improve
pros: Great benefits, good employees and room to grow and learn
cons: Senior Mgmt needs to be updated for new ideas. Employees are generally not happy and want to see changes

title: Love my job.......
pros: Working at Conway Data is like working with family. They offer flexibility when you need it.
cons: The company has some slackers in the bunch. Also has some employees that do not know what other employees do.

title: They got sold for a reason
pros: Excellent people to work with
cons: Vornado sold the Vornado/Charles E. Smith unit for a reason. It was mismanaged. Fortunately, Mitchell Schear got rewarded for it with a little gig on the board for JBG Smith.

title: Good place to start
pros: Good training and exposure to the commercial real estate world.
cons: Lack of communication from upper management, easy to feel like you are forgotten in the big picture. Low pay compared to industry competition.

title: NO upward mobility or growth in salary whatsoever.
pros: If you live in NJ hours are okay.
cons: NO real bonus, limited increase in salary. Most everyone who works in a decent role got the job due to who they are married to or who is in their family. It is a very "Mad Men" type of workplace. Have seen coffee and lunch served by their "girls" , "secretaries" and "admins".

title: Property Management
pros: Nice group of people; great benefits; management at the very top was there for a longtime, very loyal to employees
cons: Company was two separate companies in one; accounting and retail divisions practiced different ways and practices.

pros: Free food sometimes Half days on Fridays during summer
cons: Not a very welcoming culture, at times quite ciique-y Agents were not approachable, seemed like they were the only important employees

title: Best Place to Work!
pros: Vornado is the future of real estate development in NYC as they are highly focused on sustainability
cons: It is really hard to get in so do market research and become pro at the positions you are applying for

title: Assistant Property Manager
pros: Vornado is one of the nations top REITs in the country that offer many opportunities
cons: The company doesn't really seem to have a grasp on technology or processes

title: Tenant Service Coordinator Position
pros: Amazing people, some new buildings and offices
cons: Terrible pay, no growth in position or company, you learn a lot a lot in the first few months then you hit a plateau, vacation days and sick days are limited

title: Analyst
pros: Great colleagues and engaging work. As a younger person, you work alongside higher ups and are treated respectfully. They give you a lot of responsibility and teach you a lot.
cons: Some tasks one gets assigned do not get used.

title: Excellent Culture & Market Salary
pros: The company does what's necessary to keep pace with the market.
cons: Don't be afraid to exert pressure to get the comp you need.

title: Vornado is a market leading REIT
pros: Highly professional staff and management. There are always new challenges. It is a stable, well managed business.
cons: The company tends to rely on manual, customized processes as opposed to automation.

title: Good Company
pros: Beautiful corporate office, good pay and above average benefits.
cons: Some departments have high rate of turnover in upper management, which makes it difficult to understand goals and objectives that seem to shift with each new VP.

title: decent place to work
pros: Work is very interesting and challenging
cons: hours too long, no dress down policy

title: Good experience
pros: It was a great internship overall. Gave me real world experience and broadened my knowledge of the real estate industry.
cons: There weren't many cons. Worked with very nice people.

title: Great company that will allow you to learn in an entry-level real estate position
pros:
- Learning in the trenches
- Hours aren't bad
cons:
- Days get kind of long
- Small workplace environment in property management

title: Communication is the issue
pros: Good benefits and if you are in the right department can be a good experience.
cons: If you are not in the right department you will be a general asset for different groups.

title: glorified administrative assistant with more work
pros: the relief of walking out of the door everyday
cons: pretty much everything. toxic work environment. cliques. nepotism to the extreme. petty drama.

title: Great Company
pros: Pays well, excellent benefits. Some of the smartest people.
cons: Not much movement, most people stay until they die making it almost impossible for promotions.

title: Low stress, but no new tech
pros: Low stress, friendly environment, easy going work
cons: Tech stack is old and there are some clashes and compatibility issues that need to be handled on daily basis.

title: Tenant Services Coordinator Review
pros: Company with a great reputation and exposure to unique projects.
cons: Job responsibilities are slightly limited and days can become repetitive.

title: Past Employee
pros: Work life balance and decent benefits
cons: Women and minority groups aren’t given fair opportunities to thrive within this organization.

title: Liked It
pros: Liked working here, good people, nice company, good opportunity to learn the industry
cons: There were no cons, I am happy to report they are a great company

title: Great Company, Great People, Great Compensation/Benefits
pros: The people in the company are wonderful to work with.
cons: The commute was too long and they didn't have a tele-work policy.

title: Fast paste, intence environment
pros: The comany will send employees to school for training.
cons: Stressfull enivornment and lack of motivation form Management.

title: Good Stepping Stone
pros: Reputable name when moving onto other companies
cons: Corporate seemed nice. I was on-site in a property management office so there was little contact with them.

title: Finance
pros: Good hours and nice people with some exceptions...
cons: You should be fine as long as you're not in Washington DC Division. The manager is totally disrespectful and very abusive plus she has a few harassment cases reported to the HR... and they're not doing anything about it..

title: Executive Assistant

cons: no negative experience. It was excellent

title: Friendly, corporate work environment

title: Vornado Review
pros: Good working environment. Excellent location

title: Right in the middle

title: Intern

title: Good company to work for

title: Good company

title: Analyst

pros: Good experience good benefits life work balance

cons: benefits okay - dental paid by company

title: No growth opportunities
pros: Most people are nice and hours aren’t too bad

title: Neutral
pros: Competent people, interesting business, very focused on what it does best. Doesn't try to be all things to all people. Tends not to keep incompetent people around.
cons: People work in silos, which is ok unless you're interested in enjoying a broader company family and culture. Tends not to be very diverse - few women or minorities, which means that eryone basically thinks alike.

title: Love the people hate the culture
pros: Great people. Can make good friends. Most people have drive and everyone is very intelligent.
cons: No room to grow. No internal education. There is a executive staff and a lower staff. Lower staff are not encouraged to excel. Pay for lower staff is low.

title: as good as you make it...
pros: the experience is invaluable. the name alone will catapult you if this is the field you want to work in
cons: unless your relative works for the company, you title and pay will reflect same...

title: overall good stuff with good ethics
pros: highly intelligent workers and motivation
